intro: Gomidesia blanchetiana, commonly known as the Blanquet's gomidesia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
